alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Fulton; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 2:44PM EDT until March 28 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Bedford County in south central Pennsylvania... Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... Fulton County in south central Pennsylvania... Somerset County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 244 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Upper Strasburg to Central City to near Lawson Heights, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 168. The Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 101 and 184, and near mile marker 187. Interstate 81 from mile markers 1 to 25. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 6. Locations impacted include... Chambersburg, Waynesboro, Somerset, Shippensburg, Greencastle, Bedford, Meyersdale, McConnellsburg, Breezewood, Guilford, St. Thomas and Fayetteville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles.
